snippet: Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s proposal to curb low-level marijuana arrests is a start, but, for the sake of fairness, the stop-and-frisk program must be reformed.
abstract: Editorial calls on the New York State Legislature to pass Gov Andrew Cuomo's proposed decriminalization of small amounts of marijuana; notes that arcane marijuana laws led to the arrests of 50,000 teens in 2011, most of them minorities; argues that New York City must also rein in its runaway stop-and-frisk program if such useless arrests are going to be curbed.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s proposal to curb low-level marijuana arrests is a start, but, for the sake of fairness, the stop-and-frisk program must be reformed.
